title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement pgovan1@aggienetwork.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to ReliaLearnR
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit rmarkdown .Rmd, .html file. can find .Rmd files tutorials ‘/inst/tutorials/’ sub directories. example, sub directory life data analysis tutorial located ‘/inst/tutorials/lda/’.

title: Contributing to ReliaLearnR
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal example.

title: Contributing to ReliaLearnR
text: project actively developed, recommendations new tutorials always welcome. aim cover broad range reliability topics, focus primarily data-based reliability analysis methods. ideas possible future tutorials include: Repairable Systems Analysis Parametric Survival Analysis Reliability Block Diagrams propose new tutorial, like contribute tutorial, please open issue discuss .

title: Contributing to ReliaLearnR
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("paulgovan/ReliaLearnR", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header).

title: Contributing to ReliaLearnR
text: Please note ReliaLearnR project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Helper Functions
text: calculate reliability item ran 3 years total failed 5 days: 0.9954338 calculate availability item ran 3 years total, failed 5 days, scheduled maintenance 14 days: 0.9826484 MTTR can estimated base function mean. MTTR 5 failures repair times days 5, 10, 15, 8, 12: 10 estimate MTTF 1000 items ran 3 years total: 57.63158 estimate MTBF item failed 5 times total time 45,000 hours: 9000 estimate failure rate 100 items ran 5000 hours 75 failures: 0.00015 Exponential failure probability can estimated base function pexp. estimate probability survival time 5 item failure rate 0.1: 0.6065307 BnB_n life Exponential distribution can estimated base function qexp. estimate B10 life item failure rate 0.1: 1.053605
code: result <- rel(5, 3 * 365) cat(result) result <- avail(5 + 14, 3 * 365) cat(result) result <- mean(c(5, 10, 15, 8, 12)) cat(result) result <- mttf(5 + 14, 3 * 365) cat(result) result <- mtbf(5, 45000) cat(result) result <- fr(75, 100 * 5000) cat(result) result <- 1 - pexp(5, 0.1) cat(result) result <- qexp(0.1, 0.1) cat(result)

title: Learning Modules for Reliability Analysis
text: Welcome ReliaLearnR! package provides interactive learning modules fundamentals reliability analysis. modules built using learnr package cover topics life data analysis, reliability testing, reliability, availability, maintainability (RAM) concepts. package also includes helper functions common RAM calculations.

title: Learning Modules for Reliability Analysis
text: install ReliaLearnR R: install development version: Note: may prompted update dependent packages installing. , type 1 () prompted.

title: Learning Modules for Reliability Analysis
text: ReliaLearnR designed students professionals interested learning fundamentals reliability analysis. prior experience required, basic understanding R statistics helpful. complete beginners’ guide R, check resources https://education.rstudio.com/learn/beginner/.

title: Learning Modules for Reliability Analysis
text: package includes three interactive learning modules. launch modules, load package call respective function: ram() - quick reference common Reliability, Availability, Maintainability (RAM) concepts lda() - introduction Life Data Analysis rt()- introduction Reliability Testing modules can also accessed browser paulgovan.shinyapps.io/RAMAnalysis/, paulgovan.shinyapps.io/LifeDataAnalysis/ paulgovan.shinyapps.io/ReliabilityTesting/.  package also includes several helper functions common RAM calculations. functions can used independently learning modules: rel() - reliability function avail() - availability function mttf() - mean time failure mtbf() - mean time failure fr() - failure rate

title: Learning Modules for Reliability Analysis
text: learning modules designed interactive engaging, focus practical applications. module includes mix instructional content, code examples, exercises reinforce learning. modules self-paced, allowing learners progress speed. original learning modules provided series workshops, workshop covered specific module 1-2 hour period. workshops designed completed classroom setting instructor. current version modules adapted self-paced learning, can still used classroom setting instructor. adopt modules classroom use, instructors can either access via project website install package use functions directly. Instructors can also modify modules fit specific needs, source code available project repository.

title: Learning Modules for Reliability Analysis
text: project began effort build upon reliability program developed major technology company. original program proved provide strong foundation, providing structured learning opportunity helped many early-career professionals understand apply fundamental concepts reliability engineering. time, however, proprietary nature program limited accessibility adaptability. Recognizing importance keeping reliability learning relevant accessible, project initiated create open-source framework teaching reliability analysis. leveraging framework, project aims reach broader audience, encourage collaboration, ensure learning resources can evolve needs priorities change.

title: Availability (1 - unavailability / total) — avail
text: Availability proportion time system functioning condition. function computes availability given unavailable times total times.

title: Availability (1 - unavailability / total) — avail
text: unavailTime Numeric scalar numeric vector unavailable times. totalTime Numeric scalar numeric vector total times (units unavailTime).

title: Availability (1 - unavailability / total) — avail
text: Numeric scalar: availability period (0 1).

title: Failure rate (lambda) — fr
text: Failure rate frequency engineered system component fails, expressed failures per unit time. function computes failure rate given failure counts total operating times.

title: Failure rate (lambda) — fr
text: failures Numeric scalar numeric vector failure counts (non-negative). totalTime Numeric scalar numeric vector total operating times.

title: Failure rate (lambda) — fr
text: Numeric scalar: failures per unit time (failures / totalTime).

what: Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF) for repairable items. — mtbf
title: Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF) for repairable items. — mtbf
text: MTBF = total operating time / number failures. MTBF expected time consecutive failures. commonly used repairable items. behavior mttf ; keep separate name semantic clarity.

title: Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF) for repairable items. — mtbf

text: failures Numeric scalar numeric vector failure counts (non-negative). totalTime Numeric scalar numeric vector total operating times.

title: Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF) for repairable items. — mtbf
text: Numeric scalar: MTBF. number failures zero, returns Inf (warning).

title: Mean Time Between Failures (MTBF) for repairable items. — mtbf
Mean Time To Failure (MTTF) — mttf
text: non-repairable items MTTF = total operating time / number failures. MTTF expected time first failure. commonly used non-repairable items. behavior implemented mtbf ; keep separate name semantic clarity.

text: failures Numeric scalar numeric vector failure counts (non-negative). totalTime Numeric scalar numeric vector total operating times.

title: Mean Time To Failure (MTTF) — mttf

ReliaLearnR 0.3 (Formerly WeibullR.learnr)
text: package renamed WeibullR.learnr ReliaLearnR better reflect broader focus reliability engineering topics beyond just Weibull analysis. functions tutorials updated use new package name ReliaLearnR. WeibullR.learnr() function renamed lda() simplify usage. TestR.learnr() function renamed rt() simplify usage. RAMR.learnr() function renamed ram() simplify usage. references WeibullR.learnr documentation vignettes updated ReliaLearnR.

title: ReliaLearnR 0.3 (Formerly WeibullR.learnr)

New RAM vignette https://github.com/paulgovan/ReliaLearnR/issues/32.
